snippet.title: MIT 'Anklebot' gauges joint stiffness to improve rehab
snippet.description: The bot is an experimental rehabilitation tool that uses electrodes to calculate the ankle's stiffness in various directions.

snippet.title: Restaurant on Google Glasser: Man-child stinking up the joint
snippet.description: A Seattle restaurant, the latest to ban Google Glass, tells those who insist on wearing the high-tech specs to "just shut up and get out."

snippet.title: Man tries to rip chained iPad from pizza joint counter, fails
snippet.description: In a video that is as educational as it is amusing, a man cases an Illinois pizza joint, smashes the glass, but the iPad simply won't budge.

snippet.title: Nokia to buy Siemens' stake in joint venture
snippet.description: The Finnish handset maker will pay about $2.2 billion for the half of Nokia Siemens Networks that it doesn't already own.

snippet.title: Verizon scraps deal with cable for joint home, wireless services
snippet.description: Verizon confirms that the two sides are going their separate ways, although they will continue to sell each other services in areas where Verizon's landline business doesn't operate.

snippet.title: Sharp inks LCD joint venture with China Electronics
snippet.description: The state-run China Electronics will own 92 percent of the joint venture, which will produce LCDs for a wide array of electronics.

snippet.title: Lenovo in talks with smartphone party for joint venture
snippet.description: The company wouldn't name names about its conversation partner, though rumor has it BlackBerry has spoken with Lenovo in the past.

snippet.title: The F-35 Joint Strike Fighter program (pictures)
snippet.description: The next generation of strike aircraft for the Navy, Air Force, and Marines.

snippet.title: Microsoft to make a joint app store for desktop and mobile?
snippet.description: The computing giant has advertised for someone to help unify the two platforms, hinting apps could soon work across both.

snippet.title: Flying fish: Sushi joint tries table delivery by drone
snippet.description: The latest volley in the flying-food fight involves a sushi chain testing out flying quadcopter delivery of its new rice burgers to customers' tables.
